page.title: 04Shawbury R.A.F Station.
page.content: The{R.A.F Station}has been in{Shawbury for 68 years. When it opened in 1917 they took off and landed on grass.In 1920 it closed because they started to build a runway It reopened in 1937 just before the second world war. During the second world war Shawbury was training men to be multi engined aircraft pilots.This meant they could fly bombers and other sorts of aeroplanes with more than one engine. The runway circuit is 1,834 metres long . The R.A.F Station trains men to become{pilots,airtraffic controllers {and instructors}. There are 60 pilots being trained every year and 300 airtraffic controllers.The station has about 100 aeroplanes and helicopters being stored or used.There are 22{gazells,
